result.execSummary:
The defendant Reece Alan Kohn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Reece Alan Kohn is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Reece Alan Kohn was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Reece Alan Kohn was found guilty of Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant's bond shall remain in effect during said Diversion Agreement.

Defendant shall file monthly written reports with the Monroe County Justice Department certifying the defendant's compliance with the conditions specified in the agreement.

The defendant shall provide any change of address information to the Monroe County Justice Department and Monroe County Clerk of Circuit Court within 24 hours of said change.

Defendant will pay a $20.00 per month Diversion Agreement fee to the Justice Program Coordinator or designee by the 5th day of each month.

Defendant shall meet in person with the Justice Program Coordinator or designee approximately every three (3) months while the Diversion Agreement is in effect.

Defendant shall appear in court at a review hearing approximately four (4) months after the Court's approval of the agreement.  The court will schedule the review hearing and send notice to the defendant at the most recent address provided to the Clerk of Court's office.

Defendant shall undergo an AODA assessment within 60 days of the acceptance of this agreement by the Court and shall follow through with any treatment that may be recommended within 9 months of the acceptance of the agreement by the Court.

Defendant shall undergo a psychological evaluation within 60 days of the acceptance of this agreement by the Court and shall follow through with any treatment that may be recommended within 9 months of the acceptance of the agreement by the Court.

Defendant to comply with all other terms and conditions of the agreement.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent with jail in 16CM103

miscConds.notes: Obtain/maintain full time employment in an occupation acceptable to agent.

No consumption or possession of any controlled substances except those legally prescribed to defendant and take prescribed medications exactly as directed to be taken.

No possession of drug paraphernalia.

No consumption or possession of alcohol; no entering bars, taverns or liquor stores.

Complete AODA assessment and comply with treatment recommendations.

Pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

DEFENDANT ENTITLED TO 2 DAYS SENTENCE CREDIT IF PROBATION IS REVOKED.
